intro: Eberlanzia puniens, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with thick, woody stems and broad, leathery leaves. Its flowers open at dusk and close by morning, adapting to the cooler temperatures of the night. The botanical features of Eberlanzia puniens make it a unique and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
